intro: Alsodeia astrolabes, commonly known as the starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its delicate appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and wildflower displays.
